name: Ashenfelter, Orley Clark
title: Joseph Douglas Green 1895 Professor of Economics Emeritus
notes: Orley Clark Ashenfelter (born 1942) is a leading labor economist who served as editor of the American Economic Review from 1985-2001 and co-founded the Society of Labor Economists. He is a Fellow of the Econometric Society and the American Academy of Arts and Sciences, and is also president of the American Association of Wine Economists.
ngos: Co-founder of the Society of Labor Economists; Co-founder of American Law and Economics Review; NBER research associate

name: Barrett, John F.
title: Chairman, President, and Chief Executive Officer
notes: John F. Barrett joined Western & Southern in 1987 as CFO, became President in 1989, CEO in 1994, and Chairman in 2002. Under his leadership the company grew to manage assets in excess of $100 billion. He also serves on the Board of Directors of Cintas Corporation and is a member of the Business Roundtable.
ngos: Board member, Cintas Corporation; Director and past chairman, American Council of Life Insurers; Trustee, Americans for the Arts; Business Roundtable member

name: Bechtel, Gary H.
title: President
notes: Gary H. Bechtel is the son of Stephen D. Bechtel Jr. and formerly served as President of Bechtel Civil, managing national and international projects, before being elected to the Board of Directors of Bechtel Group and Companies. He later retired to Charlotte, NC where he owned NASCAR racing teams before returning to California for conservation work.
ngos: Co-chair, Delta Waterfowl; Chairman, California Outdoor Heritage Alliance; Board member, California Department of Wildlife Officers Foundation; Board member, Santa Clara County Sheriff's Advisory Board; President, The Foothills Foundation

name: Best, Randy
title: Founder and Chairman
notes: Randy Best is a Dallas-based education entrepreneur who in 2007 founded Academic Partnerships (now Risepoint), which helps public universities expand through online programs. He previously founded Voyager Expanded Learning in 1995. He is a conservative political donor who served as a major fundraiser for Jeb Bush's 2016 presidential campaign.
political_donations: Major Republican donor; key bundler for Jeb Bush 2016 presidential campaign

name: Black, Charles A. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Charles A. Black Jr. (born 1952) is the son of Charles Alden Black (Shirley Temple's husband) and Shirley Temple. His father, Charles A. Black Sr., was an executive at Stanford Research Institute and Ampex Corp before founding Mardela Corporation aquaculture firm. Charles Jr. appeared in Shirley Temple's Storybook (1958) as a child actor; detailed executive career information was not identified in public records.

name: Coghlan, John Philip
title: Independent Non-Executive Board Chair (former President and CEO, Visa USA)
notes: John Philip Coghlan served as President and CEO of Visa U.S.A. from 2005 to 2007, and as Vice Chairman of Charles Schwab Corporation. He has served on Life360's Board of Directors since 2009 and spent over 16 years as Chairman. He holds degrees from Stanford, Princeton, and Harvard Business School.
ngos: Co-founder and board member, Rivet School (education nonprofit); Board Chair, Concourse Education

name: Considine, Terry
title: Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
notes: Terry Considine is the founder of Aimco (Apartment Investment and Management Company), which he took public in 1994 and led as Chairman/CEO until a 2020 separation. A Harvard College and Harvard Law graduate, he previously served as a Republican state senator in Colorado (1987-1991) and ran for the U.S. Senate in 1992. His political contributions have been almost exclusively to Republicans.
ngos: Board member, Bradley Foundation; Established Considine Family Foundation
political_donations: Predominantly Republican donor; OpenSecrets donor profile exists

name: Cunningham, Howard A. Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Specific biographical and employer information for Howard A. Cunningham Jr. was not identified in available public records. The name does not appear prominently in SEC filings, professional directories, or major news archives under this exact name.

name: Devlin, Patrick Arthur
title: Unknown
notes: Patrick Arthur Devlin appears in Bohemian Grove membership records. Note: Patrick Arthur Devlin, Baron Devlin (1905-1992) was a prominent British judge and legal philosopher who served as a Lord of Appeal in Ordinary, but he predates the era of the membership list in question and is likely a different person. The specific living executive of this name was not positively identified in public records.

name: Eatwell, John
title: Emeritus President (former President 1997-2020)
notes: John Leonard Eatwell, Baron Eatwell (born 1945), is a British economist and Labour life peer. He served as President of Queens' College, Cambridge from 1997 to 2020, was chief economic adviser to Labour Party leader Neil Kinnock (1985-1992), and co-founded the Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR) in 1988. He holds a PhD from Harvard and has served in the House of Lords since 1992.
ngos: Trustee, Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR); Chair, CRUSAID HIV/AIDS charity (1993-1998); Chair, British Library Board (2001-2006); Chair, Advisory Board, Institute for Policy Research at University of Bath (from 2014)

name: Evans, Andrew W.
employer: Southern Company (retired); Board member, Southwest Gas Holdings
title: Former Executive Vice President and CFO, Southern Company
notes: Andrew W. Evans served as EVP and CFO of Southern Company from June 2018 until September 2021. Previously he was Chairman, President, and CEO of AGL Resources, Inc., the largest publicly traded gas distribution company in the U.S., after serving as its Treasurer, CFO, and COO during 15 years with the company. He is a graduate of Emory University.
ngos: Chair, Grady Hospital Foundation; Member, Zoo Atlanta Board; Member, Emory University Board of Trustees; Board member, Southwest Gas Holdings

name: Feulner, Edwin W. Jr.
title: Founder and President Emeritus (President 1977-2013, 2017-2018)
notes: Edwin John Feulner Jr. (1941-2025) co-founded The Heritage Foundation in 1973 alongside Paul Weyrich and Joseph Coors, and served as its president from 1977-2013 and again on an interim basis in 2017-2018. He received the Presidential Citizens Medal in 1989. He died on July 18, 2025, at age 83.
ngos: Advisory Board, Spirit of America; Mont Pelerin Society (President/Treasurer 2014); Intercollegiate Studies Institute (board of trustees); US Advisory Commission on Public Diplomacy (Chairman)
political_donations: Conservative Republican; major figure in conservative movement fundraising

name: Finch, Barnaby E.
title: Unknown
notes: A Barnaby Finch from San Diego studied economics at UC San Diego before pursuing a career as a professional musician, working with artists including Lionel Richie, Diana Ross, and George Benson. It is unclear whether this is the same individual as the Bohemian Grove member; no executive career record for a Barnaby E. Finch was found in public business databases.

name: Genderen, Warren Van
title: President
notes: Warren Van Genderen is a Harvard Business School alumnus (1960-1962) who previously served as President of Patten Corporation, a Stamford, Connecticut-based land and real estate company. He has expertise in strategic planning, corporate finance, and business development.

name: Gibson, Gregg C.
employer: Society for the Rule of Law
title: Executive Director
notes: Gregg C. Gibson is an attorney and veteran of the conservative legal movement who served as Chief Nominations Counsel to the Senate Judiciary Committee, policy counsel to the Senate Republican Policy Committee, and general counsel to Senator Marco Rubio. He holds a BA from Georgetown, a JD from the University of Chicago, and an MBA from the Wharton School.
ngos: Executive Director, Society for the Rule of Law

name: Ginsburg, Douglas H.
employer: U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit / George Mason University
title: Senior United States Circuit Judge / Professor of Law
notes: Douglas Howard Ginsburg (born 1946) was appointed to the D.C. Circuit by President Reagan in 1986 and served as Chief Judge from 2001-2008. He is also a professor at the Antonin Scalia Law School at George Mason University. In 1987, Reagan announced his intention to nominate Ginsburg to the Supreme Court, but Ginsburg withdrew following disclosures about past marijuana use.
ngos: Chairman, Advisory Board, Global Antitrust Institute; Advisory boards, Jevons Institute for Competition Law and Centre for Law, Economics and Society at University College London

name: Graham, Bradley J.
title: Co-Owner
notes: Bradley J. Graham spent more than 30 years at The Washington Post as a reporter and editor covering military and foreign affairs, authoring the books 'Hit to Kill' (2001) and 'By His Own Rules' (2009, a biography of Donald Rumsfeld). In 2011, he and his wife Lissa Muscatine purchased the Politics and Prose bookstore in Washington, D.C.

name: Graham, Jordan Walker
title: Unknown
notes: Specific biographical information for Jordan Walker Graham was not identified in available public records searches. The name does not appear prominently in SEC filings, major corporate directories, or news archives under this exact combination.

name: Greenberg, Maurice R.
title: Chairman and CEO
notes: Maurice Raymond 'Hank' Greenberg (born 1925) built AIG from a $300 million company to a $180 billion global insurer during his nearly 40-year tenure as chairman and CEO, before retiring in March 2005 amid accounting controversies. He subsequently led Starr Companies. The SEC charged him with improper accounting and he paid $15 million in penalties. He is a decorated WWII and Korean War veteran.
ngos: Honorary Vice Chairman, Council on Foreign Relations (member since 1977, board member 1992-2002, 2004-2009); Vice Chairman, National Committee on U.S.-China Relations; Former Chairman, Starr Foundation; Former Chairman and Director, Federal Reserve Bank of New York; Member, U.S.-China Business Council; Member, CSIS
political_donations: Major Republican donor; significant contributions to Republican causes and candidates

name: Greene, Frank Perry
employer: BCI Capital Management / Belvedere Capital, Inc.
title: President
notes: Frank Perry Greene (born January 1937) is a Belvedere, California-based investment adviser who graduated from Stanford with a BA in Economics (1958) and an MBA in Finance (1964). He serves as President of both BCI Capital Management and Belvedere Capital, Inc. His family has historic ties to Marin County.

name: Hazlett, William S.
title: Unknown
notes: William S. Hazlett holds a California Department of Real Estate license (DRE #01878277), suggesting involvement in the California real estate industry. Specific executive career information beyond a California real estate license was not identified in available public records.

name: Kimball, Stephen C.
title: Founding Partner
notes: Stephen C. Kimball is a founding partner of Sessions & Kimball LLP, Orange County's oldest and largest employee rights law firm, where he has exclusively represented employees for decades. He has recovered over $100 million on behalf of employees. He is a graduate of Brigham Young University and the University of San Diego School of Law.
ngos: Past Chair, Orange County Bar Association Labor and Employment Section; Board member, J. Reuben Clark Law Society

name: King, Donald Alan Jr.
title: First Managing Partner of RREEF; Global Head of Real Estate, Deutsche Asset Management (retired 2005)
notes: Donald Alan King Jr. received a BS from the University of Virginia (1962) and an MBA from Harvard Business School (1970), then served as a U.S. Navy officer. He joined RREEF in 1979 and became its first Managing Partner in 1988, growing assets from $3.5B to $17.6B. After Deutsche Bank acquired RREEF, he became Global Head of Real Estate before retiring in 2005.
ngos: Chairman, Thomas Jefferson Foundation Board (Monticello); Member, Miller Center Governing Council; Founding member and former Chairman, Pension Real Estate Association

name: Kranz, Thomas Francis
title: Of Counsel (Governmental Law)
notes: Thomas F. Kranz (born March 18, 1938, Los Angeles) is a Beverly Hills attorney practicing governmental law, administrative law, and international investment, licensed since 1965. He holds a BA from Stanford (1959), LLD from UC Berkeley (1964), and MA from UCLA (1973). He served in the U.S. Navy (1959-1961) and was nominated by President Reagan as Associate Director of FEMA for External Affairs.

name: Kuhn, Stephen Michael
title: Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Stephen Michael Kuhn is a San Francisco-based executive and entrepreneur with over 35 years of experience spanning public, private, startup, and nonprofit sectors. He was the Founding CEO and Chairman of Airex Inc., an independent marketplace for financial applications, and founded Vinum Capital Management, dedicated to private equity investment in the global wine industry. He holds a BA in Classics from UC Berkeley.
ngos: Board member and Treasurer, Gerald Huff Fund for Humanity; Interim Executive Director, ONE Conservation Network

name: Lenzen, Louis C.
title: Attorney
notes: Louis C. Lenzen (born January 8, 1943) is a California attorney admitted to the bar in 1969 who attended UC Berkeley Boalt Hall School of Law. He has been active in international affairs organizations, serving as a trustee and executive committee member of the World Affairs Council of Northern California (1973-1982) and as chairman of the San Francisco Committee on Foreign Relations (1989-1991).
ngos: Member, Council on Foreign Relations; Trustee, World Affairs Council of Northern California; Member, Pacific Council on International Policy

name: Maier, Jeffrey C.
title: Unknown
notes: Specific biographical and employer information for Jeffrey C. Maier was not identified in available public records. The name does not appear prominently in SEC filings, major corporate directories, or news archives under this exact name.

name: Murray, Dan Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: Specific biographical information for Dan Murray Jr. as a Bohemian Grove Cave Man camp member was not identified in available public records. Several California-based Dan Murrays were found in business databases but none could be positively matched to this individual without additional identifying information.

name: Pedley, Rick
title: President and CEO
notes: Rick Pedley joined PK Safety, a family-owned occupational safety and personal protective equipment supplier, in 1979 and took over as President and CEO in 1996. He moved the company from San Francisco to Oakland in 1996 and then to Alameda, California in 2001. The company, founded in 1947, has historic ties to the Golden Gate Bridge construction.

name: Reynolds, Michael Drury
title: Chairman, Founder, and CEO
notes: Michael Drury Reynolds is the founder and CEO of Bond Street Investment Trust, a private REIT headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina. He spent 1984-2013 developing real estate in the San Francisco Bay Area through Embarcadero Pacific Company, working on projects in San Francisco and Oakland. He holds a BA in French from UC Berkeley (1985).

name: Savino, Richard Cono
title: Unknown
notes: The specific individual Richard Cono Savino listed as a Cave Man camp member could not be positively identified in available public records. Multiple individuals named Richard Savino were found in public databases, including an insurance executive in New York and a music professor at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music, but neither matches the specific middle name 'Cono' definitively.

name: Schneider, Edward John IV
title: Managing Partner and COO
notes: Edward John Schneider IV (E. John Schneider IV) is Managing Partner and COO of Ohana Advisors, a boutique multi-family office serving ultra-high-net-worth clients. His background includes Head of Investment Banking at WR Hambrecht+Co (2002-2008), Senior Associate at Robertson Stephens (1997-2002), analyst at Artis Capital Management, and Corporate Development at Interactive Brokers. He holds a BA in History from Princeton.

name: Stephens, Paul Bartlett
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner
notes: Paul Bartlett Stephens co-founded Robertson Stephens & Company in 1978, a pioneering technology-focused investment bank. He later founded Stephens Investment Management LLC in 2002 and co-founded Blockchain Capital in 2013 with his brother W. Bradford Stephens, making them among the first institutional investors in cryptocurrency. He holds BA and MBA degrees from UC Berkeley's Haas School.
ngos: Past Chairman, Haas Business School Advisory Board, UC Berkeley; Board member, Duke Management Company (DUMAC); Director, UC Berkeley Foundation; Berkeley Fellow (2002)

name: Stephens, W. Bradford
title: Co-Founder and Managing Partner
notes: W. Bradford (Brad) Stephens co-founded Blockchain Capital in 2013 with his brother Paul Bartlett Stephens, creating the first firm to raise a venture fund through an ICO. Previously he was Managing Partner of Stephens Investment Management LLC and Senior Analyst at Fidelity Ventures, where he founded the Biometric Consortium. He holds a BA in Economics and Religion from Duke University (1998).
ngos: Advisory board member, Gray Area Foundation for the Arts

name: Walsh-Wilson, Alexander
title: Unknown
notes: Specific biographical and employer information for Alexander Walsh-Wilson was not identified in available public records. The hyphenated surname combination did not yield results in SEC filings, professional directories, or major news archives.
